Limited space for storage: Tiny homes have limited storage space, which can be a problem for people who need to keep a lot of belongings .
Difficulty obtaining financing: Banks and lenders may be unwilling to lend money to financing a tiny home, so it may be more difficult for people to purchase one.
Limited access to utilities: Tiny homes may have limited access to water, sewer, and other utilities, which can be problematic for daily life.
Lack of parking space: Tiny homes are usually parked on private properties, and there may be limited space available for parking.
Safety concerns: Tiny homes may have limited egress and may not be designed to meet safety standards, which can create safety hazards.
